headline: Three Bean Salad
description: This three bean salad made with green beans, wax beans, and kidney beans keeps well, serves a lot of people, and is great for summer picnics and cookouts.

video.name: How to Make Three Bean Salad

name: Three Bean Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
0.75 cup white sugar, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together green beans, wax beans, kidney beans, onion, sugar, vinegar, vegetable oil, salt, pepper, and celery seed. Chill in refrigerator for at least 12 hours.

review.reviewBody: Taste just like my mom's
Simple, easy and delicious. I mixed beans first, then remaining ingredients into a salad dressing. Added to beans, stir, chill overnight. Had all ingredients on hand :)
Glad I read reviews! Added only 1/4 cup sugar and it was plenty. Everything else was done as written.
Basic bean recipe…but I also use butter beans & garbanzo beans …plus I used a Truvia/sugar blend instead of straight sugar…
Yes was an easy recipe to make, added my own little thing to it
way too much sugar.

I did use about one half as much sugar. This recipe is very flexible. Use the beans and legumes you like best or have in the cabinet. I like red onions best, but yellow, sweet or white are all good. It keeps well unless it's eaten first.

This recipe was extremely easy to make
 It was also very inexpensive. I had some canned beans I needed to use up.
Delicious, fast and easy. Never any left. (I omit the celery seeds , personal preference).
I made it exactly and like this version a lot! Perfect for hot summer days as a non cook side dish to your grilled food which we use it for! Mix it ahead and forget about it!

This morning, my 88 year old father, who knows his bean salads, had me taste a few bites that his neighbor had made. It made me hungry for a good recipe to make some for my family. I found yours. Made it this afternoon. It’s very, very good! When I see Dad the next time, I’ll take him a sample. I think he will approve! 5 stars!

The first time I made this, it was way too sweet for my taste. I cut the sugar to 1/4 cup this time and it should be perfect. This is a very easy and delicious salad. Thank you for a recipe I will be making again and again.
I also added a can of butter beans. Next time I’ll add some garbanzo beans
This is the recipe that my mother used when I was growing up. I still make this salad like she did. It’s a great summer staple. A Family favorite.
Good recipe. A bit too sweet and a bit too much liquid but I'll make again and adjust. I also added some more salt and Italian seasoning. Turned a good recipe into a great one!
I made it exactly the same as written, except I added a small can of garbanzo beans just because I had it. I think it was fabulous. Not too sweet for me. It was so delicious I wanted to drink it!

I had 4 different types of dried beans that I cooked in the Instapot to use for chili, soI I used some of them instead of the green and waxed beans. Also used some local honey in place of the sugar. Used red wine vinegar instead of the white. My husband raved about it and am going to make more with the beans I have left.
delish!

Made this with a few modifications. I added a can of garbanzo beans,I cut the sugar back to 1/4 cup, substituted half the oil with olive oil, substituted half the white vinegar for rice wine vinegar and added a drizzle of sesame oil. Everyone loved it! Next time I may cut the sugar a bit more.
great I loved it
Just like Mom made many years ago!!
its addictive, a keeper for sure

This is the classic bean salad I was looking for. I had fresh green beans on hand which I wanted to use so I steamed them, unfortunately they lose the bright green colour after marinating overnight. Perhaps this is why people use canned? I only had a bean blend, not kidney so another substitute. Unfortunately no waxed beans so the overall size was less. I reduced the sugar due to personal taste. It was excellent and I'll be making it again soon! Thx

I thought this recipe was very good and it was a real hit at the potluck I took it to. I don’t like kidney beans so I substituted a bean that I liked better. It was a great recipe to take to the potluck since it makes 16 servings.
This is the 5th time I have made this salad. I make it exactly as written. Excellent...
Wish I would have read the reviews before making this. WAY too much sugar. I should have known.
Delicious! Made as directed except used 1/4 cup sugar. It was perfect.

Best recipe ever! The only change I make is adding one can red kidney beans, one can black beans and one can chick peas. This recipe provides the ideal base to add whatever you want! On its own it's perfect too!
I just made this. The grocery store had no wax beans so I doubled the green beans. I love 3 bean salad and this one is a really good one. I only wish I could have gotten the wax beans for the color.
5 star
I have actually made this salad hundreds of times
Easy to make and tastes so good. I like making a double batch
Easy to make and tastes so good. I like making a double batch

Made salad with few changes/additions. Added only 2 -3 tablespoons finely diced red onion, 1/4 cucumber diced small along with 1/2 Red Bell Pepper and 1/4 Green Bell Pepper diced small. Made dressing exactly per recipe. Added additional salt, pepper, cayenne & good dose of Aleppo pepper for some heat. Outstanding after 24 hr marinating!
Maybe use less vinegar, but otherwise loved it!!
Delicious!! I cut the sugar to 1/4 cup and it tasted great! I used garbanzo beans in place of wax beans. Will definitely make again!
Yes I will ,I love this salad .my mom use to make it for my family ,

As others commented, this is a sweeter dressing. I followed the recipe as written, (but added garbanzo beans because i had extra cans) and it was a hit with family and friends. Thank you:)
Edit: I also made it substituting celery salt for regular salt, since i didn't have celery seed, and it came out great

I love onions, but make sure that it's a small onion. A large onion is just too much for the proportion of other veggies. Also, I added garbanzo beans (chickpeas), like my mom used to. Tasty way to get added fiber and veggies, especially once you're burnt out on traditional salad!
The best three bean salad. I use 2/3c sugar and it is just as good as Rudy BBQ. You can also put half of bell pepper for added flavor
it reminded me of a German aunts bean salad had as a kid.
Very good. I substituted a can of black beans for the wax beans and used 1/2 of sugar. Next time I would use still less sugar.
So good! It was really delicious.
Wonderful! Definitely benefits from marinating overnight.
We make this all the time, tastes just like an old school steakhouse 3 bean salad...but...it only needs 1/4 cup sugar and add a can of garbanzo beans.
I used garbanzo beans instead of wax beans and cooked green beans from my garden. Very good!
Wonderful as good my Mom's from30 years ago. saved in my favorites.
Excellent summer food for when it's too hot to cook baked beans and when you would like a change from potato salad or cole slaw. And nothing could be simpler to assemble.

It's hard to imagine how this recipe could be improved upon. It is fantastic and quite flexible in that a variety of beans can be used. The marinade is spectacular, but obviously only if you enjoy a sweet salad. I did use Splenda in place of sugar and will probably reduce it to 1/4 to 1/2 next time; it was plenty sweet. I prefer diced onions to rings, so that's how I rolled on this recipe, but I loved it and will make this a staple for future healthy eating. Beans, beans, beans!
everyone loved. I used 1/4 cup less sugar, added 15 oz can yellow wax beans and can of chick peas. will definitely be making again.

I used green beans and kidney beans as the beans were fresh from the garden. I was greedy even though I knew better. I tried the salad after 24 hours and really did not like it. I waited for 5 days and let it marinate and it was wonderful. So don't be greedy like me and taste too soon. Plan on making it 5 days before eating the salad. Probably could eat in 3 days but 5 days were good. In 5 days you are going to need a vegetable or salad anyway and this salad will be ready.

I made this and I should have listened to the people who wrote the same comment - leave out the sugar. It doesn't add anything to the recipe, and it actually tastes a little odd with it. Also, it could use something else, but I don't know what - adobo? garlic salt? Just a little something else would help. Still, it's great for a barbeque when 60 people are coming over.
I followed the recipe and loved it. The sweetness brings out the flavors. We use it as a green salad topping, drained most often. But it’s a great evening snack for that sweet tooth.
One of my all time favorite three been recipes! I did cut back the sugar to 1/4 cup. It is delicious and so easy to make!
I made it exactly as the recipe said and it is so good. And people that put other beans in it like garbanzo, that makes it a 4 bean salad. I was looking for a 3 bean and this is delicious.

I made this with avacado oil, white balsamic vinegar and 1/4 cup of coconut sugar. I added my new favorite ingredient: sweety drop peppers, which look pretty, but are also sweet and spicy. I love the celery seed in this recipe; adds a nice dimension.
Excellent three bean salad!!! This is better than our old family three bean salad recipe. I’ll be making this all summer!!!
It was great!

Great traditional recipe. I added one can of garbanzo beans.
Because we have a diabetic in the family, I substituted Splenda for the sugar and I couldn't tell the difference.
I don't care for celery seed, so I did omit that.
easy to follow instructions and very tasty.

A great salad. I went with the original recipe with the following additions and changes. Instead of white vinegar, I mixed half cider vinegar and half balsamic vinegar. Added 1 tsp brown and yellow mustard seed, and a dash of ground cinnamon. I believe this salad is more like bread and butter pickles, therefore meant to be sweeter. I'll follow the original recipe next time, but will always use cider vinegar; less acidic.
I LOVE this salad. It's refreshing and light. I intend to make it again using less sugar.
Just what I was looking for - simple and fool-proof! I substituted bell peppers for the onion, since I'm not a fan of onion, and the flavor and colors were a good complement.
simple , quick, and easy...... big hit with the family

This recipe is a good example of why I always read the reviews. Half of the sugar is perfect! Nice balance of flavors, and so versatile. I use whatever beans I have on hand, and it turns out great every time. I also dice the onions. A solid 4.
Delicious! Even without salt (i do not add salt if i can get away with it)

Used my Pampered Chef Spiralizer for onion (with blade). Did not add as much onion as called for, it just seemed like too much. Easy to make. But directions do not specify whether to drain all cans. I did. I used canned wax beans. Also, I didn't have celery seed so I used 2 tablespoons of finely minced fresh celery.

I make this up all summer long...and I have some in my fridge even now, as cold as it is.
I add a can of black beans, a can of garbanzos, about 1/2 cup of chopped celery and 1/2 cup chopped carrots.
I also do different proportions for the sweet and sour since I don't care for so much sugar. I use 1/4 c honey, 1/2 c vegetable oil and 1 1/4 c apple cider vinegar. Increase the celery seed to 1 teaspoon, the same for the salt. I use red onion, milder than white or yellow. Makes about 3 quarts.

As I use up the salad solids, I reserve the liquid in a quart canning jar. I partially drain a can of sliced beets and put those into the leftover liquid. After soaking for two days, the beets are nicely pickled and ready to be used in salads or on their own.

I did change it just a little but this was a huge success at the party. I used a can of green beans, a can of wax beans, a can of kidney beans, and added a can of garbanzo. I decreased the sugar to 1/2 cup. Other than adding the garbanzo and decreasing the sugar, I followed the recipe. You could omit the onions, which I have done and it is great with or without. Can’t go wrong with this recipe.
To sweet

Really good dressing for this salad! Doubled the whole recipe and took it for a pot luck. Believe it or not, the store was out of wax beans - so I used Butter Beans & got a bunch of compliments. Also used cider vinegar and avocado oil instead of distilled vinegar and vegetable oil.
Followed recipe exactly. Just a little sweet so I added a little more vinegar. Very tasty. Definitely make it again but cut the sugar just a little.
I start with this, add garbanzos, dark red and light red kidney beans, omit wax beans [I'm NOT a fan], throw in a half a chopped red pepper [and a little red pepper in the dressing] and it's great!
Decreased sugar to 1/2 C and added 1 can drained garbanzos to stretch for a crowd. Good basic recipe and just right for me.
I added chopped water chestnuts for extra crunch.
Too much oil for my tastes.

Pretty much as I remember. I made it as it was written but ended up having to add more vinegar. It was WAY too sweet.
Made it a second time and tweaked the dressing..I used 2/3 cup vinegar, 1/2cup sugar and 1/3 cup oil. I used red onion this time and liked that better, too. My family really likes this salad and it's so handy to keep around in summer, it makes a great snack when you're hungry for a little something!
I needed a quick and easy salad to take to a potluck and decided to make this salad. Fast preparation the night before and a delicious salad for the table.

This is delicious- if you cut the sugar to 1/2 C. and add a big splash of apple Cider Vinegar AND let it set for a day....I didn't like it very well at first but let it set overnight and its delicious! I also added a pint of garbanzo beans.....

Easy, fast and delicious. Have made it several times and added to taste profile with a little garlic powder and dill weed. Can also add a bit diced green or red peppers if you have some and I use sliced red onions. Make sure to let it stand for at least several hours to develop the flavors.
I have this in my fridge all summer. I add any vegi's that I have. My boys love it too.
Very Good and very easy to make. A little sweet. Next time I’ll try cutting the sugar in half but I’ll definitely make it again.
Three bean salad is a favorite of ours. We liked this recipe, but found it to be a little too sweet. I will definately make it again, but I'll cut the amount of sugar I use.
I use baby cilantro instead of parsley - absolutely delicious. And Newman's Own parmesan & roasted garlic dressing is perfect for the vinaigrette.

I only used this recipe as an outline. Used 1 can ea corn, chick peas, garbanzos and cannellini beans. Then added cucumber half an onion and 3 garlic cloves. 2 limes, lil acv, sliced cherry toms salt and pepper. 2 tsp sugar was plenty.made this OIL FREE and it was amazing topped with avocado ?? slices.
It was easy to put together and was delicious! I probably would use a little less sugar next time though.
Yes i will make it again!

Keeping this in my recipe box to find again and again. 
The only changes I made was more green beans than wax (what I had on hand) and I halved the onion due to personal taste.
excellent, would not change a thing. I have never liked 3 bean salads but made it for the wife and i loved it.

I make this bean salad all the time. This is the same recipe my mother made 40 years ago. It is a great salad to take to a pot luck as it feeds a lot of people. Always have great compliments on this dish. I don't change anything in this recipe.

12.29.17 Haven’t made three bean salad in years, and we used to live on it when first married...for two people, it lasted a while! Actually, I think I lost my original recipe, so was happy to see this on the AR site. I did make a few changes. I used Orange Muscat Champagne Vinegar (I know, sounds pretty fancy for a bean salad and I sure didn’t use that when first married!) instead of the milder white viinegar, used Splenda® instead of sugar (cut that back to 1/2 cup), and reduced the oil to 1/4 cup. This was like a blast-from-the past, and I found myself eating it out of the mixing bowl, but eventually, I did put it in the fridge overnight for the flavors to meld. This was so tasty, and I’ve saved this in my Favorites, so it won’t be lost again.

Shades of my mom's favorite. We grew up with this, and it's the first time I' very made it in years. Sweet & sour marinades are an individual flavor choice and this is a bit sweet for my crew. Definitely less sugar next time. Another suggestion from my own experience for a different twist: we used to occasionally add shoestring cut cooked beets to this bean mix, let it marinate overnight, drain it and add a spoonful of plain yogurt.

I made a minestrone soup and had leftover canned red kidney beans and green beans. This recipe came in handy to use those up. I did not have wax beans on hand to add. I cut the recipe in half, and it worked great with the amounts that I had. I cut back on the sugar just a little. Nice recipe - thanks!

The best and easiest bean salad ever. I added garbanzo beans and reduced sugar to 1/3 cup. I also changed fresh wax beans to canned wax beans because the fresh ones would not soften even after 24 hours. My husband loves it and I have made it several times. Great for buffets.
to sweet, and I used less sugar. wife liked it...
Needed to cut back on sugar and oil to suit my taste, but a good recipe.
I made it with fresh green and wax beans. My husband liked it more when it was first made because the flavors were more individualized. I thought it was better the longer it sat.
This is my forth time making time for myself and I waste none of I love it it got just the sweetness but I can't wait for the next day .

This is soooo much better than that stuff in a can, and I'll be making this again. It makes so much that it's going to my next pot luck dinner too. I did make some miner changes based on reviews. I decreased the sugar to 1/2 cup, used canola oil, and added 1 cup frozen corn (thawed) and 1 can drained & rinsed cannellini beans (or garbanzo beans). I figure that this will serve 30 (1/2 cup each), so be sure to use a large bowl with room to stir every so often.
